meta.purpose: Map NT caregiver descriptions to functional priors and ND-style interpretations
notes: Text is optional input; treated as a prior, not a real-time signal.
Used to bias Boltzmann/Gibbs fusion over video/audio energies.
ND-style interpretation is NOT diagnosis; it is caregiver-facing explanation.

priors.nt_description: We are at the school entrance and my child does not want to go inside.
priors.nd_interpretation: Transitions are hard. The child may need to start together or know the exact next step. Fear can be hidden until the last moment.
caregiver_guidance: Explain the next two steps only.
Offer to start together (walk in side by side).

priors.nt_description: He was fine all morning, then suddenly started crying.
priors.nd_interpretation: The child may have been holding stress quietly. Crying appears when capacity is exceeded, not when the problem started.

priors.nt_description: He keeps asking the same question again and again.
priors.nd_interpretation: Repeated questions often mean uncertainty, not curiosity. The child is checking safety or rules.
caregiver_guidance: Use a visual or timer if possible.

priors.nt_description: He laughs but something feels wrong.
priors.nd_interpretation: Laughter can appear during anxiety or overload. Emotion may be mixed rather than purely happy.
caregiver_guidance: Check context rather than facial expression alone.

priors.nt_description: He became very quiet and stopped talking.
priors.nd_interpretation: Silence does not always mean calm. The child may be freezing or recovering from overload.
